org.vanilladb.core.storage.record

Class RecordPage

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.vanilladb.core.storage.record.RecordPage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Record
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    TempRecordPage

    public class RecordPage
extends Object
implements Record
    Manages the placement and access of records in a block.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RecordPage

        public RecordPage(BlockId blk,
                  TableInfo ti,
                  Transaction tx,
                  boolean doLog)
        Creates the record manager for the specified block. The current record is set to be prior to the first one.
        Parameters:
        blk - a block ID
        ti - the table's metadata
        tx - the transaction
        doLog - will it log the modification

    • Method Detail

      • offsetMap

        public static Map<String,Integer> offsetMap(Schema sch)
        Returns the map of field name to offset of a specified schema.
        Parameters:
        sch - the table's schema
        Returns:
        the offset map

      • recordSize

        public static int recordSize(Schema sch)
        Returns the number of bytes required to store a record with the specified schema in disk.
        Parameters:
        sch - the table's schema
        Returns:
        the size of a record, in bytes

      • slotSize

        public static int slotSize(Schema sch)
        Returns the number of bytes required to store a record slot with the specified schema in disk.
        Parameters:
        sch - the table's schema
        Returns:
        the size of a record slot, in bytes

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes the manager, by unpinning the block.

      • next

        public boolean next()
        Moves to the next record in the block.
        Returns:
        false if there is no next record.

      • getVal

        public Constant getVal(String fldName)
        Returns the value stored in the specified field of this record.
        Specified by:
        getVal in interface Record
        Parameters:
        fldName - the name of the field.
        Returns:
        the constant stored in that field

      • setVal

        public void setVal(String fldName,
                   Constant val)
        Stores a value at the specified field of this record.
        Parameters:
        fldName - the name of the field
        val - the constant value stored in that field

      • delete

        public void delete(RecordId nextDeletedSlot)
        Deletes the current record. Deletion is performed by marking the record as "deleted" and setting the content as a pointer points to next deleted slot.
        Parameters:
        nextDeletedSlot - the record is of next deleted slot

      • insertIntoTheCurrentSlot

        public boolean insertIntoTheCurrentSlot()
        Marks the current slot as in-used.
        Returns:
        true, if it succeed. If the slot has been occupied, return false.

      • insertIntoNextEmptySlot

        public boolean insertIntoNextEmptySlot()
        Inserts a new, blank record somewhere in the page. Return false if there were no available slots.
        Returns:
        false if the insertion was not possible

      • insertIntoDeletedSlot

        public RecordId insertIntoDeletedSlot()
        Inserts a new, blank record into this deleted slot and return the record id of the next one.
        Returns:
        the record id of the next deleted slot

      • moveToId

        public void moveToId(int id)
        Sets the current record to be the record having the specified ID.
        Parameters:
        id - the ID of the record within the page.

      • currentId

        public int currentId()
        Returns the ID of the current record.
        Returns:
        the ID of the current record

      • currentBlk

        public BlockId currentBlk()
        Returns the BlockId of the current record.
        Returns:
        the BlockId of the current record

      • runAllSlot

        public void runAllSlot()
        Print all Slot IN_USE or EMPTY, for debugging
